>So said suyash_says on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>
>   Hello every o=
ne. !!!
>            Pls help me. i want to run the same testcase with 20 
=
>different set of values of an arg that gives me 20 unique results. I 
>don=
't want to hard code these values. Is there some dynamic way to do 
>so tha=
t doesn't increase overheades of writing test case.
>                      =
              Regds
>                                             - Suyash
=

Yes, there is. Here is a sketch of the solution.

1. Add a constructor to =
your TestCase subclass that accepts the parameters you want to use for each=
 test. Store those parameters in the test fixture (instance variables).
2. =
Create ONE test method that uses the test fixture and runs the test.
3. Cre=
ate a suite() method that loops through your test data and uses your new co=
nstructor to push test data into the test fixture.

You can code your suite=
() method any way you want: it can read data from a file or a database, for=
 example.

A more complete example will be available in the book "JUnit Coo=
kbook" sometime in late 2003/early 2004. :)

Take care.
